alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 8:08PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM HST, radar indicated a large band of heavy rain moving across the island of Molokai this evening. This band will slowly drift eastward across Molokai over the next few hours. Heavy rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The entire island of Molokai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1130 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. A Flood Watch is also in effect for all Hawaiian Islands until Tuesday at 6 PM HST.
